activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey M Finch

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Corey M Finch in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Defendant is to go to SPD office after court.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's NOI to Intro Expert Testimony

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:58 PM Defendant Corey M Finch in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
